metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized November 7, 2025 - Enhanced CAN-07 guidance, specialized task keywords

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (view pending invitations and prioritize), constraints (timeframe: this week), and priorities (customer meetings, product strategy).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify key entities.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events and invitations for the specified timeframe (this week) from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Needed to get the raw set of events to filter pending invitations.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events, including RSVP status, attendees, and other relevant details to identify pending invitations.
execution_plan.note: Critical for determining which invitations are still pending.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, team sync) based on title, attendees, and context.
execution_plan.note: Enables filtering and prioritization by meeting type.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance of each pending invitation relative to the user's stated priorities (customer meetings and product strategy).
execution_plan.note: Ranks meetings by importance to help prioritize.

execution_plan.description: Match pending invitations against the user's explicit priorities for this week to produce a prioritized list.
execution_plan.note: Final prioritization step aligning with user preferences.

execution_plan.description: Generate a clear, user-friendly display of pending invitations and their priority ranking for this week.
execution_plan.note: Provides the requested 'show me' output in a visual format.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If classification or importance scoring fails, fallback to showing pending invitations without prioritization.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings this weekâ€”flag the ones I need to prep for, and put time on my calendar to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that user wants to find important meetings this week, flag those requiring preparation, and schedule prep time.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current week to identify which meetings exist.
execution_plan.note: Needed to analyze meetings for importance and preparation requirements.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to help determine preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Provides foundational data for assessing importance and prep requirements.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help determine which meetings typically require preparation.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification to support prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to identify which ones are critical and likely need preparation.
execution_plan.note: Subjective evaluation to flag high-value meetings.

execution_plan.description: Estimate preparation time for each flagged meeting based on complexity, number of attendees, and available documents.
execution_plan.note: Determines how much time to allocate for preparation.

execution_plan.description: Check the user's calendar for available slots to schedule preparation time without causing conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Ensures prep sessions fit into the user's schedule.

execution_plan.description: Create new calendar events for preparation sessions in the identified available slots.
execution_plan.note: Schedules the actual preparation time on the calendar.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If availability check fails, notify user and suggest manual adjustment; retry retrieval and classification on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Show me how my meeting time is broken down this month and where I could reclaim time to focus on product development.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (analyze meeting time breakdown), timeframe (this month), and goal (identify reclaimable time for product development).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current month to analyze meeting distribution.
execution_plan.note: Required to get the raw data for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer) to understand how time is allocated across meeting categories.
execution_plan.note: Helps break down meeting time by category.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and reschedulability of meetings to identify which ones could be reduced or eliminated to reclaim time.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings are less critical and could be deprioritized.

execution_plan.description: Aggregate total time spent in meetings by category and compute statistics to show distribution of meeting time.
execution_plan.note: Provides quantitative breakdown of meeting time.

execution_plan.description: Generate visual charts or graphs to display how meeting time is distributed and highlight areas where time can be reclaimed.
execution_plan.note: Addresses the 'show me' requirement by creating a visual representation.

execution_plan.description: Provide personalized recommendations on which meetings to shorten, skip, or consolidate to free up time for product development.
execution_plan.note: Delivers actionable insights aligned with the user's goal.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 3 and 4 could partially overlap after event retrieval, but typically sequential for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, fallback to textual summary; if recommendation engine fails, still provide time breakdown.

compositions.prompt_text: Schedule my weekly 1:1 with Alex every Monday at 10am. If there's a conflict, auto-bump movable meetings.

execution_plan.description: Parse user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring 1:1), constraints (weekly, Monday 10am), attendee (Alex), and conflict handling rule (auto-bump movable meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'Alex' to a specific contact in the user's directory to ensure correct attendee is invited.
Generate RRULE for weekly recurrence on Mondays at 10am.
Retrieve user's calendar events for the relevant timeframe to check for conflicts with the new recurring meeting.
Check availability for Mondays at 10am across the recurrence period to identify conflicts.
Extract metadata from conflicting meetings (importance, attendees, reschedulability) to determine which can be bumped.
Classify conflicting meetings by type (e.g., team sync, 1:1, customer) to help decide which are movable.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02B after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Assess strategic importance and reschedulability of conflicting meetings to prioritize which can be bumped.
Apply conflict resolution policy: auto-bump movable meetings based on type and importance scores, and finalize schedule for the new recurring meeting.
Create the new recurring 1:1 event with Alex on Mondays at 10am and update any bumped meetings with new times.

parallelization_opportunities: Step 7 (CAN-02A) and Step 8 (CAN-02B) can run in parallel after Step 6
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification; if conflicts cannot be resolved, escalate to user for manual decision.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to focus this afternoon. Bump all movable meetings to tomorrow or later this week.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent ('reschedule meetings'), constraints (timeframe: this afternoon, reschedule to tomorrow or later this week), and priorities (focus time, only bump movable meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - needed to interpret natural language and extract actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events scheduled for this afternoon and the rest of the week to identify which meetings are candidates for rescheduling.
execution_plan.note: Required to know which meetings exist in the specified timeframe.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for each event such as RSVP status, attendees, and any notes that indicate flexibility or importance.
execution_plan.note: Needed to determine which meetings are movable and to inform importance assessment.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer call) to help determine which meetings are more or less movable.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification helps in deciding reschedulability.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to identify which ones can be postponed without major impact.
execution_plan.note: Subjective assessment ensures only low-importance meetings are bumped.

execution_plan.description: Check availability for tomorrow and later this week to find suitable slots for rescheduling the movable meetings.
execution_plan.note: Required to ensure new times do not create conflicts.

execution_plan.description: Apply scheduling constraints to find optimal new slots for the movable meetings based on availability and user preferences.
execution_plan.note: Ensures rescheduling respects all constraints.

execution_plan.description: Handle any unsatisfiable constraints or conflicts by prioritizing which meetings to move and escalating if necessary.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by 'bump' keyword; ensures conflicts are resolved gracefully.

execution_plan.description: Update the calendar by moving the identified meetings to their new time slots.
execution_plan.note: Executes the actual rescheduling in the calendar.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If availability check fails, notify user; if constraint satisfaction fails, escalate with options; retry updates if API errors occur.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a team sync for next Tuesday at 2pm with Sarah, Mike, and the design team. Book the large conference room and prioritize this over non-customer meetings if there's a conflict.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule a team sync), constraints (next Tuesday at 2pm), attendees (Sarah, Mike, design team), resource requirement (large conference room), and priority rule (prioritize over non-customer meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve names 'Sarah', 'Mike', and 'design team' to actual directory entries and expand the design team group into individual members.
Retrieve the user's calendar events for the relevant timeframe (next Tuesday) to check for conflicts and availability.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, meeting type, and RSVP status to support prioritization and conflict resolution.
Classify existing meetings (e.g., customer vs non-customer) to apply the prioritization rule mentioned in the prompt.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02B after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance of existing meetings to determine which can be deprioritized if conflicts occur.
Check availability of all resolved attendees for next Tuesday at 2pm to ensure the requested time works.
If conflicts exist, resolve them by applying the prioritization rule (prioritize this meeting over non-customer meetings) and suggest rescheduling lower-priority events.
Book the large conference room as requested for the scheduled meeting.
Create the new team sync event with the specified time, attendees, and booked resource.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 and step 6 can run in parallel after step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If resource booking fails, suggest alternative rooms; if attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification; retry transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull together a prep agenda for my customer pitch on Friday, including recent work updates from the team.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create prep agenda), identify target meeting (customer pitch), date (Friday), and additional requirement (include recent work updates from team).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for the relevant timeframe (Friday and surrounding days) to locate the customer pitch meeting and related context.
Classify retrieved events to confirm which one is a 'customer pitch' meeting based on meeting type.
Extract metadata for the identified customer pitch meeting, including attendees, attachments, notes, and logistics to inform agenda creation.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and agenda generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments or pre-read documents associated with the customer pitch meeting.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with step 6 as both depend on metadata.

execution_plan.description: Analyze recent team collaboration patterns and documents to identify recent work updates relevant to the pitch.
execution_plan.note: Provides the 'recent work updates from the team' requested by the user.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured prep agenda for the customer pitch meeting, incorporating meeting details, retrieved documents, and recent team updates.
execution_plan.note: Final deliverable: a formatted agenda document.

parallelization_opportunities: Step 5 (Document Retrieval) and Step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after metadata extraction.
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with agenda using available metadata and updates; if work attribution fails, generate agenda without recent updates.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull a briefing doc for my 1:1 with Jamie tomorrow, including what we've been working on.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (generate briefing doc), meeting identifier (1:1 with Jamie), and timeframe (tomorrow).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve calendar events for the specified timeframe (tomorrow) to locate the 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
Classify retrieved events to confirm which one is a 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
execution_plan.note: Ensures correct identification of the meeting format (1:1).

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the identified meeting, including attendees, RSVP status, and any attached documents or notes.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and briefing generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments, pre-reads, or shared documents linked to the meeting.
execution_plan.note: Provides supporting materials for the briefing doc.

execution_plan.description: Analyze past meetings and collaboration patterns with Jamie to identify what you've been working on together.
execution_plan.note: Generates context about shared work history for inclusion in the briefing.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing document that includes meeting details, retrieved documents, and a summary of past work with Jamie.
execution_plan.note: Final output: a formatted briefing document for the upcoming 1:1.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (Document Retrieval) and step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with briefing using available metadata and work summary; retry failed retrieval asynchronously.

compositions.prompt_text: Create a summary of all team meetings this quarter and what we accomplished.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create summary), timeframe (this quarter), meeting type (team meetings), and output requirement (what was accomplished).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events within the specified timeframe (this quarter) from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Provides the raw set of events to filter and analyze.

execution_plan.description: Classify retrieved events by meeting type to identify which ones are team meetings.
execution_plan.note: Filters events to only include team meetings as requested.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from team meetings such as attendees, notes, and any attached documents that might indicate accomplishments.
execution_plan.note: Provides detailed meeting content needed to summarize accomplishments.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured summary document of all team meetings and what was accomplished, using extracted metadata and notes.
execution_plan.note: Produces the final summary output requested by the user.

orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to using event titles and descriptions for summary; retry retrieval on transient errors.
